comments:
Hello everybody,
I use Eclipse Platform to run BIRT reports for my web application. I use Tomcat 5.0.28 on Windows XP and Tomcat 5.5.17 on MAC OS 10.4. To start Eclipse Platform I use following code:
                // startup the platform
                if ( engine == null )
                {
                    EngineConfig config = new EngineConfig( );

                    IPlatformContext platformContext = new PlatformServletContext(
                            servletContext );
                    config.setPlatformContext( platformContext );
                    
                    Platform.startup( config );
                    IReportEngineFactory factory = (IReportEngineFactory) Platform
                            .createFactoryObject( IReportEngineFactory.EXTENSION_REPORT_ENGINE_FACTORY );
                    engine = factory.createReportEngine( config );

                    engine.changeLogLevel( Level.WARNING );
                }
It worked well until I added following lines in my catalina.bat file:
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djava.security.manager=java.rmi.RMISecurityManager
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djava.security.policy==C:\tomcat\conf\catalina.policy
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=C:/myproject/mykeystore
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStore=C:/myproject/mykeystore
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword=somepasswd
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Djavax.net.ssl.keyStoreType=jks

When I did so, Platform refused to start with java.lang.ClassCircularityError

Searching throug Bugzilla showed no related results, so please advise what can be done in this situation.

Full error log is following:

Simon, Can you give some explanation?  Why only the GetDataFileAction needs to be loaded early?  Are there other inner classes that will give us issues?

Me too! I too would like to understand how this fix works.

Is this problem similar to the one with extensions described in the bug 5875?

Oleg, I doubt it is similar to bug 5875 (Which I have a fix for in bug 135885).

It is more likely that a permission check is being done while in the middle of loading the inner class which causes another recursive permission check which causes the same inner class to be loaded again on the same thread.  This will cause a circularity error.

I suspect this is similar to the hack that is in FrameworkSecurityManager to make sure its inner classes are loaded ahead of time.  But I would like Simon to confirm.

bug 5875 is about a class loading cycle. This one is about a permissions check cycle. It looks similar in that the classloading is what's causing the permission check. In that sense, this is similar to bug 119069 and also bug 105450.

The GetDataFileAction is involved in the permission check that starts from ConditionalPermissionCheck.implies(...) and then ConditionalPermissionInfoImpl.addPermissions(...). I did an audit and didn't see any other risky inner classes, but we'll have to watch this. 

Note: I'm a bit worried about the instantiating of the Permission, but it's probably ok as a live instance is passed in when the original implies is checked. Still, I'd welcome others to take a look at this chain.

re: Patch
I've add another static pre-loader for the PrivilegedAction in PackageAdminImpl.
PackageAdmin is used by the URLStreamHandlerFactory and so the action is likely to occur whenever parsing a policy file as they frequently contain URLs.

--
Comment:
When creating embedded instances of Equinox there are two practices that would improve isolation and help prevent ClassCircularityError (where the parent class loader is causing a check)
1) Use a child-first class loader for loading the framework. In this way all of the various inner classes used in the framework would be safe from checks in the parent loader.
2) Avoid using osgi.parentClassLoader "fwk" especially when bootdelegation is *.

I released the patch to allow you to make progress.  But I'm concerned that this is not a complete fix.  

I agree with Simon's comments in comment 22 about bootdelegation and the use of osgi.parentClassLoader "fwk".  Ideally we would like to disable bootdelegation * and we would like to make the bundle parent classloaders just be the boot classloader.  This would prevent these types of ClassCircularityErrors but more importantly it allows for much more control over what classes you make available from outside the OSGi container.

somewhat aside, should there be a general "nested" flag that turns on a set of options (perhaps if not already configured) that make sense when someone is running Equinox embedded in something else?  Seems like making people set this property and tath property is problematic.  Just  a thought
